instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b no green light, no amber light, no fan spin water damage
threads.message:
I have no clue where to start, I got lucky by having a few donor boards for my last jobs and was able to just swap out clearly damaged parts. Where should I start for this one?
kind regards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b no green light, no amber light, no fan spin water damage
threads.message:
Voltage on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>???? 
Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>???
Where is water damage??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b no green light, no amber light, no fan spin water damage
threads.message:
I can say that most of the water damage is over by J6700 and J3500, or at least I hope I am correctly telling you. <CAPACITOR>C3577</CAPACITOR> looked really terrible so I pulled that. I don't think I am supposed to ask this but I have tried finding it online about how to measure <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> but I am not sure. If I measure <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> at L6995 then it is 3.478.  If I can measure <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on F9700 then it is 12.26.
I hope this is right info I am giving you. This is my first real try to fix a board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b no green light, no amber light, no fan spin water damage
threads.message: PPBUS at 12.23 means SMC is not running. Is <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> high? Is <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b no green light, no amber light, no fan spin water damage
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.429     <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> =3.25 but jumps around a lot not going over 3.2 or under 3.24

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b no green light, no amber light, no fan spin water damage
threads.message: Looks like dead SMC or crap under it. Try some flux and heat but do not reflow. If that does not help replace it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b no green light, no amber light, no fan spin water damage
threads.message:
ok, I also did not ultrasonic it yet, should I also perform that step?
kind regards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b no green light, no amber light, no fan spin water damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b no green light, no amber light, no fan spin water damage
threads.message: nothing after heating, but after ultrasonic=green light and fan spin!! Thanks so much Duke and everyone who helped me!
